content:
It seems like you are installing NGINX on an Amazon EC2 instance running Ubuntu 22.04.1 LTS. NGINX is a popular web server that can be used to serve static content, reverse proxy dynamic content, and load balance traffic. To install NGINX, you can follow these steps:

1. Connect to your EC2 instance using SSH:
```java
ssh -i "NODEJS.pem" ubuntu@ec2-3-109-174-93.ap-south-1.compute.amazonaws.com
```
Replace "NODEJS.pem" with the name of your PEM file and "[ubuntu@ec2-3-109-174-93.ap-south-1.compute.amazonaws.com](mailto:ubuntu@ec2-3-109-174-93.ap-south-1.compute.amazonaws.com)" with the public DNS of your EC2 instance.

2. Update the package lists and upgrade the installed packages:
```sql
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get upgrade
```
3. Install NGINX:
```csharp
sudo apt-get install nginx
```
4. Start NGINX:
```sql
sudo systemctl start nginx
```
5. Check the status of NGINX:
```lua
sudo systemctl status nginx
```
6. If everything is working properly, you should see a message that says "active (running)" in the output of the previous command. You can also test the NGINX installation by navigating to the public DNS of your EC2 instance in a web browser. You should see the default NGINX welcome page.
